title: How to Add and Activate a Device on Netflix

steps.title: Open the Netflix app on your Smart TV or streaming device.
steps.content: Open the Netflix app on your Smart TV or streaming device. Netflix is an available app for many Smart TVs and streaming devices, such as Roku , Apple TV , Amazon Fire Stick , and more. [1] X Research source To see a list of all supported devices, visit Netflix's Devices page . If needed, you can install Netflix . Some devices have Netflix pre-installed and/or have a Netflix button on the remote.

steps.title: Click Sign in.
steps.content: Click Sign in . This is the red button. If you're logged into another account, navigate to the left sidebar. Scroll to the very bottom, then select Get help on the bottom right. Scroll down and click Sign out .

steps.title: Click Sign in from Web.
steps.content: Click Sign in from Web . You'll need to bypass the on-screen keyboard to select this option. Instructions will appear on the screen, along with a website you need to visit on a web browser. You may also see an option to sign in with a QR code . If you’d prefer to sign in this way, open the camera on your phone or tablet and use it to scan the code. Tap the link that appears, then follow the onscreen instructions to sign in with your device. [2] X Research source Some Smart TVs or streaming devices may allow you to sign in directly from the TV using your remote. In these cases, select Sign in , answer Yes when asked if you are a Netflix member, and use your remote to enter your email and password. [3] X Research source

steps.title: On your computer or mobile device, visit Netflix's activation page.
steps.content: On your computer or mobile device, visit Netflix's activation page . You can use a desktop or mobile browser. In some cases, the activation website may differ. Netflix will list the appropriate website on your TV.

steps.title: Enter the code displayed on your TV and click Continue.
steps.content: Enter the code displayed on your TV and click Continue . Use the code on your TV to complete the text field on your web browser.

steps.title: Enter your login details.
steps.content: Enter your login details. Use your email or phone number and password to log in. Above the sign-in fields, you will see "Successfully connected to (your device name)". If you're already logged in on your browser, Netflix will begin activating your device immediately.

steps.title: Click Start Watching.
steps.content: Click Start Watching . You will see a success prompt on your web browser. Your device will automatically log in to Netflix. You can now watch movies with Netflix . Netflix keeps track of your device streaming activity. You can check this by going to https://www.netflix.com/manageaccountaccess in a web browser. Log in if needed. View recent activity associated with each device.

steps.title: Visit the Manage Account Access page.
steps.content: Visit the Manage Account Access page. This page allows you to view and edit the devices that are currently linked to your account. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Review your current devices.
steps.content: Review your current devices. If you suspect someone is using your Netflix account without your permission, you may be able to confirm by looking for unfamiliar devices on the list. You can also use this page to see which profiles connected to your account last used each device. It can take up to 48 hours for a new device to show up on your Account Access page.

steps.title: Click Sign Out to remove a device.
steps.content: Click Sign Out to remove a device. This will log you out of Netflix on that device. If you want to use Netflix on the device in question again, you will have to log back in. You can also click the Sign Out of All Devices button at the bottom of the screen to log out of everything at once.

steps.title: If you see a “There was a problem signing in” error:
steps.content: If you see a “There was a problem signing in” error: This error can indicate a problem with your device, your network, or your account settings. [5] X Research source There are a few different things you can try if you see this message or something similar: [6] X Research source Make sure the email and password you’re using to sign in are correct. If you’re pretty sure they are, you may need to reset them . Restart your device. If it’s a TV or streaming device, unplug it from power, wait 1 to 3 minutes, and plug it back in. Restart your modem or router. Reset the network settings on your device to their defaults. This might involve turning off a VPN if you have one, or turning off custom DNS settings. Reset the Netflix app. The right way to do this depends on your device, but check out our guide to resetting Netflix on a Smart TV for general instructions.

steps.title: If you see a “Sorry, something went wrong” error:
steps.content: If you see a “Sorry, something went wrong” error: This problem usually goes away on its own after a while, but there are a few things you can try if it doesn’t. [7] X Research source Restart your device. If it’s a streaming device or TV, unplug it, wait a few minutes, then plug it back in. Go to https://netflix.com/clearcookies . This will sign you out of your account and clear cookies associated with your account. You’ll need to sign back in. Restart your modem or router. Reset your device’s network settings. If you have a VPN, try turning it off. You can also try resetting your modem or router to default settings. Reset or reinstall the Netflix app. Make sure your payment method is still valid. You can also try changing your login information.

steps.title: If you see a “This device isn’t part of your Netflix Household” error:
steps.content: If you see a “This device isn’t part of your Netflix Household” error: This means that Netflix has detected a device that doesn’t match the profile for your household based on data like device IDs and IP addresses. Here’s what to do if this happens: [8] X Research source Select Confirm Device when prompted. Select either Send Email or Send Text . Follow the instructions in the text or email to verify your account. Select Continue to Netflix on your TV.

steps.title: If you see a “Netflix is no longer available on this device” error:
steps.content: If you see a “Netflix is no longer available on this device” error: Unfortunately, this message means that Netflix is not supported on the device you’re using. [9] X Research source You’ll have to switch to watching it on a compatible device. You can find a list of supported devices here .

steps.title: Your plan determines how many devices you can use at once.
steps.content: Your plan determines how many devices you can use at once. You can log into Netflix on an unlimited number of devices, but the type of plan you have limits how many devices can be active at the same time. For example: [10] X Research source The Standard and Standard with ads plans allow you to watch on two supported devices at once. The Premium plan supports watching on four supported devices at once. You can also add extra members to your account with the Standard and Premium plans. Each extra member can watch on one supported device at a time. [11] X Research source

steps.title: Netflix can detect if a device is part of your household.
steps.content: Netflix can detect if a device is part of your household. If you’re having trouble activating a certain device on your account, it’s possible that Netflix has detected that the device doesn’t belong to a member of your “Netflix Household.” This is determined automatically using a combination of factors such as account activity, device IDs, and IP addresses. [12] X Research source You can always update your Netflix Household to add a new device if necessary.
